unnormalised: Regarding the recent debate on copyright infringement of Bollywood songs, it is crucial to remember that under the Copyright Act, 1957, simply changing the lyrics while retaining the musical composition can still constitute a violation. Case law, such as that of Super Cassettes Industries Ltd. vs. Mr. Chintamani Rao & Ors., has highlighted the importance of originality. The judgement delivered on 22/07/2010 clarifies the point. Seeking legal counsel from Adv. Sharma is advisable before releasing any potentially infringing material, and registering a trademark under Trademark Act, 1999 is suggested to avoid future issues. It is noted that Section 51 of the Copyright Act needs to be carefully considered to avoid penal consequences.
